text: Master’s Degrees (M.A., M.A.L., M.Div.) and Doctor of Ministry
STEP 1. FILL OUT THE APPLICATION FORM
With your application, you’ll answer questions about your education, work, and service history. Here’s what else you’ll need for the application form:

Resume: an up-to-date resume with your employment background, including part-time work, as well as community, volunteer and/or family experience, indicating positions of leadership, offices held, and awards or recognition received
Vocational Statement: a 1-2 page document describing the direction or goals that led you to apply to United Theological Seminary of the Twin Cities
Request official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions you have attended and have them emailed to United’s admissions office at
United Theological Seminary of the Twin Cities
Download the appropriate recommendation form and send it to three references to fill out and return to United’s admissions office.
One pastor or spiritual mentor, attesting to your call and/or spiritual discernment
One employer or professional reference, attesting to your work ethic
Ready to apply to United Theological Seminary?

Making the decision to discern a call to ministry brings up questions and reflection for many prospective students. We’re eager to actively help you as you explore these questions throughout your seminary journey.
Are you ready for the challenges of theological and spiritual education?
Will seminary help you discover yourself, fulfill your calling, and equip you to do the work you want to do for the world?
How will United help you bring it all together to prepare you for what’s next?

The Admissions team at United is here to do more than walk you through the admissions process. We’re here to get to know you, to hear your story, and to partner with you as you explore yourself and what seminary can do for you. Reach out today and find out what role United can play as the “next right thing” in your journey towards faith or spiritual leaders.

Applying to United is about more than just filling out the right paperwork. It’s a journey of discovery–even if you don’t end up coming to school here. Get started below by learning more about the application process, getting started with financial aid, or exploring our vibrant campus.
Denominations and world faith traditions represented
Which program is right for you? United’s academic programs equip you for vocations of care, service, and advocacy.
How will you pay for school? Our financial aid office will help you explore funding options like FAFSA and scholarships.
Looking for an online graduate program? Our distance education courses are designed to fit your already busy life.
